pull.title: Add note for repository to add new wordlists
pull.body:
Many wordlists were proposed here, but they were closed with the following note:

> For now, [the author(s) of BIP 39 have decided not to accept any further word lists into BIP 39 itself, and encourage adding new ones to the WLIPs repo](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1129#issuecomment-873258377) here: https://github.com/p2w34/wlips

I have added the note to the BIP's wiki so that people will know where to open these PRs going forward.

events.message: Add note for repository to add new wordlists

issue.title: Involve the Bitcoin Design Community
issue.body: @p2w34, can we involve the folks from the design community on this project? I personally feel they will have a lot to contribute given that the project is still in its infancy. This project also seems like an accessibility standard, I'm sure they will be happy to contribute. Have you tried to get folks from there to look at the project?

events.body: Hey @prusnak and @slush0, could you check whether this is still correct today and matches your intention for BIP39 wordlists?
No. My intention is not to support any wordlists except for the English one to maximize interoperability.
Thanks @prusnak. IIUC this should therefore be closed, and `bip-0039/bip-0039-wordlists.md` updated?

issue.title: hebrew.txt
issue.body: Incorporating list of 2048 Hebrew words, taken from the book of the Torah

issue.title: BIP39 Turkish Wordlist - Proposal
issue.body:
Words chosen using the following rules:

1. Words are 3-8 letters long.
2. No very similar words with 2 letter of difference.
3. Only nouns, adjective and adverbs, no other word types.
4. No words with double vocals (like: saat).
5. No complex verb forms.
6. No plural words.
7. No words that remind negative/sad/bad things.
8. No words with double spelling.

events.body: I’m closing this PR, because one of the authors declined this proposed change to their BIP.
